description:
USDA Organic
Coffee Free
Acid Free
Prebiotic
All Purpose Grind
Vegan
Certified Organic by QAI
Kosher Parve 
Naturally caffeine free - better than decaf
Acid Free - helps restore alkaline balance
Natural energy boost - from nutrients, not stimulants
Heart-healthy potassium - for optimal performance
Prebiotic - Inulin, a soluble fiber in chicory root, supports gut health to improve digestion, elimination and the immune system.
Energizing maca root enhances velvety chocolate layered over a lush, dense body from roasted ramon seeds and chicory roots. 
Enjoy Teeccino's deliciously rich, deep-roasted flavor that delivers all the satisfaction without the caffeine and acidity of coffee! Discover why Teeccino fans describe it as smoother, richer, and creamier than coffee. The secret? French chicory, the roasted root often added to coffee, blended with barley, Italy's favorite caffeine-free roasted brew, and Spanish carob, famed for its chocolaty flavor. Enriched with maca, the Peruvian energizing herb, a cup of Teeccino brims with many health benefits:
Most of Teeccino's ingredients are grown in Europe and the USA. We pioneer new trade for organic chicory with smallholder farmers in India and for wild harvested ramón seeds with rainforest villagers in Central America. These ingredients create economic opportunities where income is scarce. By drinking Teeccino, you join us in supporting families devoted to organic, fair trade values in both developed and emerging countries.
direction: Adjust brewing strength and add milk, non-dairy milk, & sweetener or drink black according to personal preference.
Use 1 rounded Tbsp per 2 cups of water.
Use 1 rounded Tbsp per 10 oz. water.
Permanent filters work best and save trees!
Add 1-2 Tbsp to '3-cup' pots, 3-4 Tbsp to '8-cup' pots. Steep for 3 minutes.
Use double porta-filter and 1-2 rounded Tbsp. Brew according to machine instructions.

Chill brewed Teeccino. Teeccino can last days when refrigerated! Or, make a strong brew by using 2 Tbsp per 2 cups water and pour the hot brew over ice. Add cold milk or nondairy milk and sweeten to taste.
Begin brewing 3/4 coffee to 1/4 Teeccino. Gradually decrease coffee and increase Teeccino until you are caffeine-free!
ingredients: Organic carob, organic barley, organic chicory, organic maca, organic ramón seeds, organic chocolate flavor, organic cocoa, organic chile flakes.
Produced on machinery that also processes almonds.
About gluten: Independent laboratory tests can not detect gluten in brewed Teeccino when using a paper filter or tea bag.

description:
4 Flavors: Black Cherry, Coconut, Grapefruit, Tangerine Chamomile
Featuring Sustainably Sourced Beeswax, Olive Oil, Sunflower Oil & Vitamin E
Formulated to be: USDA Organic, Non-GMO, Cruelty-Free
Made with Eco-Friendly & Biodegradable Ingredients
No Sulfates, No Preservatives, No Artificial Fragrances & No Animal Testing
Certified Organic by Oregon Tilth
Bee good to your Lips!.
Our Sustainable, USDA-Certified Organic Beeswax is sourced from established Bee Farmers who meet our stringent social, environmental and economic requirements.
We purchase our USDA Organic Beeswax from well-established bee farmers, who are often the third or fourth generation in the trade and have learned from decades of hands-on experience. Their livelihood is dependent on the ethical and humane collection of crude wax and honey. These farmers take pride in providing a high quality, consistent products year after year, without endangering bees or other wildlife.
The collection of our Organic Beeswax takes place in organized apiaries, or out in the wild — where collectors do their best to ensure the bees are well cared for. By constantly monitoring the hives, farmers can make certain the bees are healthy and well fed throughout the year, especially during times of drought or frost. Many of our bee farmers use wooden hives, which are hung from trees, so wild animals cannot disturb them.
In addition, the majority of our bee farmers contribute to ongoing government and university-funded research. This crucial research is intended to develop better ways to handle bees, and keep them safe in their natural habitat.
Organic Beeswax is a naturally sustainable product from Mother Nature. It is up to us to protect bees, so that they will continue to pollinate and produce high-quality Organic Beeswax for generations to come.
Enjoy all the

Maca is power. Native to the Andean Region, the maca plant has been used for thousands of years as a whole-food resource for health and vitality. As one of the world's most sought-after adaptogenic superfoods, maca root bolsters the body's ability to adapt to life's physical and emotional stressors. Its powerful nutrients support hormonal and emotional balance, boost energy levels, increase stamina and support fertility and sexual function in both men and women.
The Zint Difference: While maca in its raw form can be difficult for some to digest, our organic maca powder is gelatinized to remove the starch, concentrate the nutrients, and enhance digestibility. We take pride in sourcing our maca from family-owned farms in the Andes mountains of Peru. Our suppliers harvest and sell their produce in accordance with fair trade values.

Frontier® Dandelion Root is a sunny, subtle, yet incredibly healing plant used for thousands of years in China and long prized by herbalists for its cleansing action. It is also packed with essential vitamins and minerals. Almost every herbal tradition has noted it as a useful tonic for the liver and gallbladder. Frontier Dandelion Root can be used fresh in green drinks, salads and stews in miniscule amounts to add nutritional value.
 Bulgaria
 Taraxacum officinale G.H. Weber ex Wigg.
DANDELION ROOT - Frontier Co-op offers high quality Dandelion Root (Taraxacum Officinale) in 1 pound bulk packaging. Dandelion Root is known for its cleansing actions and nutritional benefits packed with essential vitamins and minerals. The root is a quality addition to any cuisine or use for a cup of herbal tea. Our bulk Dandelion Root is kosher certified and non-irradiated.
DIGESTIVE HEALTH - Dandelion root has been used for thousands of years in China and is long prized by herbalists for its cleansing action. The traditional use for dandelion root is to support a healthy digestive system.
VERSATILE USES - While often used in teas, dandelion root is a great addition to incorporate in juices, salads, stews, and soups. Being packed with essential vitamins and minerals, dandelion root can add nutritional value as an ingredient to any recipe. Dandelion root can also be blended into other herbal tea blends, made as a coffee, or infused in DIY body care recipes.
ORIGIN/SOURCING - Dandelion root has been prized by herbalists for centuries. Our dandelion root is grown in Bulgaria and is kosher certified and non-irradiated.   
ABOUT US - Owned by stores and organizations that buy and sell our products, Frontier Co-op has been a member-owned cooperative since 1976. We support natural living and our products are never irradiated or treated with ETO (Ethylene Oxide) . We’re committed to the health and welfare of the environment and everyone producing and consuming our botanical products.
direction: To prepare as a tea, pour 8 oz. water in a pot and boil. Add 2 tsp. of herb, cover and simmer 10-20 minutes, strain and serve immediately.

TOP-QUALITY MILK THISTLE SEED - Frontier Co-op organic milk thistle seed (Silybum marianum) has a long history of use, both as a food and for its wellness benefits. The nutty tasting seeds can be utilized in many different ways. Our bulk whole milk thistle seed is kosher certified and non-irradiated.
LIVER HEALTH - The liver works to keep the body free of harmful substances and toxins. The seeds have long been associated with wellness benefits and modern research has verified most of those historical uses. Milk thistle seed supports a healthy liver and historically has been used as a liver tonic and in various digestive formulas.
VERSATILE USES - Milk thistle seed can be consumed in many ways, as a tea, in capsules, as a tincture and of course in food. Use the whole seed to sprinkle on salads, sandwiches, and mix in with trail mix, or easily ground down the seed to incorporate into tea, baked goods, and smoothies.
ORIGIN/SOURCING - Used for centuries as food and for its healthful properties, milk thistle seed has a long tradition of use in herbalism. The seeds originate from Bulgaria and are harvested from the milk thistle seed pod once ripe and dried. The milk thistle plant itself can grow up to 4-5 feet tall and has lettuce like leaves with spiky purple flowers.
ABOUT US - Owned by stores and organizations that buy and sell our products, Frontier Co-op has been a member-owned cooperative since 1976. We support natural living and our products are never irradiated or treated with ETO. We're committed to the health and welfare of the environment and everyone producing and consuming our botanical products.

Collagen, hyaluronic acid, and vitamin C all contribute to the health and wellbeing of the musculoskeletal system. 
 
 contains all three of these ingredients to help support healthy hair, skin, nails, joints, and bones.* The unflavored powder can be quickly added to your favorite drink, providing a convenient way to add collagen to your diet.
Collagen is the primary structural protein found throughout the body and provides crucial infrastructure, both inside and out. There are many types of collagen that differ by how the molecules are assembled and where the collagen is used in your body. Our 
 powder contains both type I and type III collagen, which are 2 of the 5 main types of collagen:
: This type of collagen makes up 80 to 90% of your body’s total collagen. Because it is densely packed, type I collagen provides structure to skin, bones, tendons, and ligaments.
: Found in elastic cartilage, such as knees and shoulders, this type of collagen provides support for joints.
: This type of collagen is commonly present with Type I and is found in muscles, arteries, and organs. 
: Found in the layers of your skin, type IV collagen helps support various functions of the skin.
: This type of collagen is found in the cornea of your eyes, bones, some layers of skin, hair, and tissue of the placenta.
Our advanced collagen formula also includes two additional powerhouse ingredients – hyaluronic acid and vitamin C. Hyaluronic acid is a component of connective tissue and can provide the fluid matrix for joint lubrication, skin hydration, and repair.* Vitamin C plays a role in the production of collagen and assists in antioxidant protection.* Research suggests that regular consumption of these nutrients can provide the body with the fundamental building blocks that can help to support the health of joints, bones, skin, hair, and nails.*
 
 features non-bovine, marine-sourced collagen peptides with hyaluronic acid and vitamin C. The specially processed fish collagen is enzymatically hydrolyzed (broken down) into low molecular weight component amino acid peptides in order to help ensure optimal absorption and bioavailability.*

direction: 1) Place two tablespoons of sprouting seeds or 1/2 cup of legumes/grains in a sprouting jar with three times as much water as seeds. Soak overnight. For many small seeds, five hours of soaking is sufficient.
2) Drain the water from the jar. Rinse seeds in fresh, lukewarm water and drain again. For well drained seeds/spouts, lay jar at an angle in a warm (70ºF), dark place.

3) Rinse and drain seeds twice a day. In hot and dry weather, you may need to rinse the seeds three times a day. In very humid weather, the seeds should be kept in a dry place. Turn jar over gently. Overturning the jar rapidly will cause shifting in the sprouting seeds. This can break the tender shoots and kill the spout. This breakage causes the sprout to spoil. Sprouts should be ready to eat in 3-5 days, depending on the seed used. Put in sunlight during the last day to add chlorophyll.

Camu Camu (
) is a tropical superfruit indigenous to South American that can be found along the flooded areas of the Amazonian Rainforest which gives access to Native peoples to harvest the fruit directly into canoes. The Camu Camu tree has been planted along floodplains as part of reforestation projects because of their hardiness and their productivity as a food source.
 is a dry milled whole berry powder sourced from Peru. Camu Camu Berries are known to contain a wide variety of naturally occurring phytonutrients such as Vitamin C and polyphenolic antioxidant-like compounds such as flavonoids. The tart sour taste can add a twist in recipes that call for lemon, lime and other citrus-like flavors.
